SVG Icon System

This page demonstrates how to use an svg icon system. I won't touch on the build process as that can be seen by studying the repo.

View Icons

Inline SVG <use> with External Source

The CSS

In this system, icons receive the .icon class. Icon width and height is set to 1em. This allows the icons to inherit font size - therefore specific widths and heights DO NOT need to be set! It's a beautiful solution.

.icon {
  display: inline-block;
  fill: currentColor;
  height: 1em;
  line-height: 1;
  position: relative;
  top: -1px;
  vertical-align: middle;
  width: 1em;
}

Basic Usage

Using an external svg sprite gives us caching and the ability to use inline svg. For additional information and caveats, see Chris Coyier's great explanation.

Remove SVG Fills! For single-color icons, all "fill" definitions should be removed from each svg icon so that the icons can inherit the body color and be colored using CSS.

 = <svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="icons/sprite.svg#heart"/></svg>
 = <svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="icons/sprite.svg#fire"/></svg>

Adding Color

Now that you understand the basics, let's add some color. In this example, we are simply adding a contextual color class to the icon class. You could just as easily use a inline style.

 = <svg class="icon text-danger"><use xlink:href="icons/sprite.svg#heart"/></svg>
 = <svg class="icon text-success"><use xlink:href="icons/sprite.svg#fire"/></svg>

In this example, you'll see how the icons inherit color from their parent.

<p class="text-info">
  <svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="icons/sprite.svg#heart"/></svg>
  <svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="icons/sprite.svg#fire"/></svg>
  <svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="icons/sprite.svg#cog"/></svg>
  <svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="icons/sprite.svg#warning"/></svg>
  <svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="icons/sprite.svg#tag"/></svg>
  <svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="icons/sprite.svg#user"/></svg>
</p>

Inside Anchor Tags

In this example, you'll see how icons are used in an achor tag. Notice how the icons inherit CSS transitions from the anchor tag.

I love this link! 

<a href="#"><svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="icons/sprite.svg#heart"/></svg> I love this link!</a>
